abstract: In a letter to a federal judge, the Justice Department said it still required help despite its success in gaining iPhone data in a separate case.
snippet: In a letter to a federal judge, the Justice Department said it still required help despite its success in gaining iPhone data in a separate case.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With the legal battle over one iPhone now behind them, lawyers for the Justice Department and Apple resumed their sparring in another case on Friday, as prosecutors told a federal judge in Brooklyn that they still needed the company’s help to unlock a drug dealer’s iPhone.

headline.main: U.S. Presses Bid to Force Apple to Unlock iPhone in New York
headline.print_headline: New Push  to Unlock  an iPhone in Brooklyn

byline.original: By Eric Lichtblau and Katie Benner
